login.title: Sign in
login.oidcNoAccount: No account connected to this identity. Log in with email and password first, then connect your account in Profile.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: Manage your account settings and language preferences.
profile.connectedAccountsDescription: Link external identity providers for faster sign-in.

customers.title: Customers
customers.description: All customers associated with your partner account.

dashboard.title: My products
dashboard.description: Your active products and the services included with each.

webroots.title: Webroots
webroots.description: Web applications and sites hosted on this account. Each webroot has its own runtime, environment variables, and configuration.

envVars.title: Environment Variables
envVars.description: Key-value pairs injected into your application's runtime environment. Secret variables are encrypted at rest.

vault.title: Vault Encrypt
vault.description: Encrypt sensitive values into vault tokens that can be safely committed to git.
vault.info: Encrypt a secret value to get a vault token. Paste the token into your .env file in git. Values prefixed with vault:v1: are encrypted and can be safely committed.
vault.secretPlaceholder: Enter the secret value to encrypt...

daemons.title: Daemons
daemons.description: Long-running background processes managed by the platform. Each daemon can optionally expose an HTTP proxy port.
daemons.proxyPortHelp: HTTP port your daemon listens on. The platform will route traffic from the webroot to this port.
daemons.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

cronJobs.title: Cron Jobs
cronJobs.description: Scheduled tasks that run at specified intervals using standard cron syntax.
cronJobs.scheduleHelp: Standard cron expression: minute hour day month weekday (e.g. */5 * * * * for every 5 minutes).
cronJobs.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

fqdns.title: Hostnames
fqdns.description: Domain names attached to this webroot. Traffic to these hostnames is routed to this application.
fqdns.detachMessage: Are you sure you want to disconnect "{{name}}" from this webroot?

settings.title: Webroot Settings
settings.description: Configure the runtime, version, and public folder for this webroot.

terminal.title: SSH Terminal
terminal.description: Connect to your webroot via an interactive SSH terminal session.

databases.title: Databases
databases.description: PostgreSQL databases provisioned for this account. Manage users and connection settings.

users.title: Database Users
users.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete user "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

valkey.title: Valkey Instances
valkey.description: In-memory key-value stores (Valkey/Redis-compatible) for caching and real-time data.

users.title: Valkey Users
users.keyPatternHelp: Redis key pattern this user can access. Use * for all keys.
users.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete user "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

wireguard.title: WireGuard VPN
wireguard.description: Create WireGuard VPN tunnels to securely access your MySQL databases and Valkey caches from your local machine. Each peer generates a configuration file you can import into the hosting-cli tool or any WireGuard client.
wireguard.empty: No WireGuard peers configured. Create a peer to get a VPN tunnel for direct database and cache access.
wireguard.name: Name
wireguard.configWarning: Save this configuration now. The private key will not be shown again. You can import this file into hosting-cli or any WireGuard client.

delete.title: Delete Peer
delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this WireGuard peer? Any active tunnels using this configuration will stop working.

s3Buckets.title: S3 Buckets
s3Buckets.description: S3-compatible object storage buckets for files, media, and static assets.

accessKeys.title: Access Keys
accessKeys.secretWarning: Save your secret access key now. It will not be shown again.
accessKeys.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the access key "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

settings.title: Bucket Settings
settings.publicDescription: When enabled, objects in this bucket can be accessed without authentication.

emailAccounts.title: Email Accounts
emailAccounts.description: Email accounts and mailboxes. Configure aliases, forwarding, and auto-replies.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the alias "{{name}}"?

forwards.title: Forwards
forwards.keepCopyLabel: Keep a copy in this mailbox
forwards.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the forward to "{{name}}"?

autoreply.title: Autoreply
autoreply.subject: Subject
autoreply.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the autoreply configuration?

dns.title: Domains
dns.description: DNS zones for your domains. Manage records to control where your domain names point.

records.title: DNS Records
records.ttlHelp: Time to live in seconds. Controls how long DNS resolvers cache this record.
records.priorityHelp: Lower values have higher priority. Mail servers try the lowest-priority record first.
records.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the {{type}} record "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

sshKeys.title: SSH Keys
sshKeys.description: Public SSH keys for secure server access. Add your keys to enable SSH login.
sshKeys.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the SSH key "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

backups.title: Backups
backups.description: Automatic and manual backups of your services. Restore to recover from a previous point in time.
backups.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the backup "{{name}}"?
backups.restoreMessage: Are you sure you want to restore the backup "{{name}}"?

developer.title: Developer
developer.description: API documentation and integration tools for building with the Control Panel API.

apiDocs.title: API Documentation
apiDocs.description: The Control Panel API follows REST conventions. All endpoints require JWT authentication unless noted otherwise.

mcp.title: MCP Integration
mcp.description: Connect AI assistants like Claude Code to manage your hosting resources using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

setup.title: Setup Guide
setup.step1Detail: Sign in to the control panel and use the same JWT token your browser session uses. Pass it as the Authorization header.
setup.step2Detail: Add the following to your .mcp.json file (e.g. in your project root for Claude Code):
setup.step3Detail: Your AI assistant will now have access to all control panel operations: managing webroots, databases, DNS, email, and more.

error.title: Something went wrong
error.description: We're having trouble loading this page. This is usually temporary â€” try again in a moment.
